sentences.sContent: His hands were manacled behind his back.
sentences.sCn: 他的双手被铐在了身后。

sentences.sContent: He was manacled by the police.

trans.tranOther: an iron ring on a chain that is put around the wrist or  ankle  of a prisoner
If a prisoner is manacled, their wrists or legs are put in manacles in order to prevent them from moving or escaping
